page.title: 20TOURISM IN NORTH HAMPSHIRE
page.content: Faccombe is popular as a riding and walking area. It is used regularly by the Ramblers' Association who keep a check on footpaths and signposts. The public house, recently refurbished, provides snacks, meals and accomodation. From a height of 700ft on the Hampshire Downs, Linkenholt overlooks the valley of the Bourne, across to Doles Wood and Tangley Clumps. To the east & north the famous walking area of Sheepless Hill and Summer Hill are dwarfed by Inkpen Beacon and Warbury Hill. A sight line has recently been made; it is said that on a clear day the Solent and the Isle of Wight can be seen from a vantage point at Faccombe.
